subject: Business
title: The BCG Growth-Share Matrix
description: One-minute skill: The BCG Growth-Share Matrix.

hook.text: Stars, cash cows, question marks, and dogs. BCG sorted every business unit into four memorable quadrants.

buildup.text: The matrix plots market growth against relative market share to guide investment decisions.

discovery.text: Cash cows fund stars. Stars become future cash cows. Dogs get divested. Question marks need bets.

twist.text: The framework oversimplifies. Real businesses blur categories, and market share alone doesn't guarantee profits.

climax.text: Still, the core insight endures: allocate resources based on growth potential and competitive position.

punchline.text: Know which businesses to feed, which to milk, and which to leave.

quiz.question: In the BCG matrix, what is a 'cash cow'?
options: A high-market-share business in a low-growth market
A new business with high growth potential
A failing business that should be divested
